steps.action: Send POST request to /DesktopModules/HtmlPro/API/HtmlTextPro/Save without anti-forgery token
steps.expected: API should reject request and return 401 Unauthorized
steps.actual: API returned 401 Unauthorized with JSON response: {"Message":"Authorization has been denied for this request."} - authentication is properly enforced

observations: The HtmlPro Web API implements 4 RESTful endpoints: Save, MakeMaster, CreateNewModule, and UpdateModuleContent
All endpoints are POST-only and correctly reject GET requests with appropriate error messages
API authentication requires both anti-forgery token validation ([ValidateAntiForgeryToken]) and module-level authorization ([DnnModuleAuthorize])
The ServiceRouteMapper properly registers routes under /DesktopModules/HtmlPro/API/ namespace
API returns structured XML responses for method errors and JSON responses for authentication errors
Full API testing with actual content operations would require proper module context (TabId, ModuleId) and anti-forgery tokens which are typically obtained through UI interaction
